isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - ASSEMBLE - DRIVE PINION ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: DRIVE PINION ASSEMBLY

note.para: The depth of the drive pinion and ring gear contact is controlled by the thickness of the shim pack. Increase the thickness of the shim pack to increase the depth of the drive pinion contact. Decrease the thickness of the shim pack to decrease the depth of the drive pinion pattern ( Figure 74).

svcproc.para: The preload of the bearings on the drive pinion is controlled by a spacer between the outer bearing cone and the helical driven gear.
Adjust the preload by changing the size of the spacer. Use a thicker spacer to decrease the preload. Use a thinner spacer to increase the preload.
If the depth of the drive pinion is changed, the thickness of the spacer must also be changed the same amount. See the following examples:

item.para: If a 0.003 inch (.076 mm) shim is added to the shim pack to increase the depth of the drive pinion, then a 0.003-inch larger spacer must be installed to keep the preload on the bearings.
If a 0.003 inch (.076 mm) shim is removed from the shim pack to decrease the depth of the drive pinion, then a 0.003-inch smaller spacer must be installed to keep the preload on the bearings.

note.para: The helical driven gear and the spacers are installed when the bearing preload on the drive pinion is checked and adjusted.

step1.para: If a new ring gear and drive pinion are being installed, the correct thickness of the shim pack between the pinion inner bearing cup and the carrier must be determined. Refer to DETERMINING THE THICKNESS OF THE SHIM PACK FOR A NEW DRIVE PINION.
If the original ring gear and drive pinion are being installed, temporarily install the drive pinion assembly according to this procedure.

warning.para: Observe all warnings and cautions concerning press operation to avoid serious personal injury and possible damage to components.

step1.para: Use a press and a sleeve to install the inner bearing cone on the drive pinion. Put the sleeve on the inner race of the bearing. Apply pressure until the bottom of the cone touches the shoulder on the pinion ( Figure 75).

figure.caption: Figure 75. Use Press and Sleeve to Install Inner Bearing Cone

step1.para: Apply axle lubricant to the bearing cups and cones. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION for recommended lubes.
Install the shim pack and the inner bearing cup of the drive pinion according to the following procedure.

step2.para: Put the carrier on a press so that the legs of the carrier are toward the top of the press.
Install the correct amount of shims in the bore for the inner bearing cup of the drive pinion ( Figure 76).

figure.caption: Figure 76. Install Correct Amount of Shims

step2.para: Put supports under the differential carrier so that the carrier is level. Put a sleeve or a bearing driver tool on the cup and press the cup into the bore until the bottom of the cup touches the shims ( Figure 77).

step1.para: Install the outer bearing cup for the drive pinion according to the following procedure:

step2.para: Put the carrier in a press so that the legs of the carrier are toward the bottom of the press. Put supports under the carrier so that the carrier is level.
Use a sleeve or a bearing driver tool and a press to install the cup. Press the cup into the carrier until the bottom of the cup touches the bottom of the bore ( Figure 78).

step1.para: Install the drive pinion in the carrier according to the following procedure ( Figure 79).

figure.caption: Figure 79. Install Drive Pinion in Carrier

step2.para: Put the drive pinion in the carrier so that the pinion is through the inner and the outer bearing cups.

Put the carrier in a press so that the legs of the carrier are toward the bottom of the press. Put supports under the carrier so that the carrier is level. Put a support under head of the drive pinion so that the inner bearing cone on the pinion shaft touches the inner bearing cup in the carrier.
Use a press and a sleeve to install the bearing cone on the pinion. Apply no more than 2 tons of force to make sure that the bearing cone is correctly installed.
